chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm
Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jade M Bowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

miscConds.notes:
To be determined.  Atty H Hertel allowed 30 days to respond.
Pursuant to Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 09/28/2015, $24,881.81 represents restitution plus $2,488.18 restitution surcharge.
Pursuant to Restitution Hearing on 07/14/2016, Court orders $500 per month as restitution payment (83.6% to Monica B. and 16.4% to John T, effective 08/01/2016.  A $2,000 payment is to be made within 30 days with the same distribution as monthly payments).

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with: Monica Binetti or John Tobisch.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Submit a DNA sample.  Write letter of apology to victims.

timeConds.notes:
re Count 5.
Pursuant to Restitution Hearing on 07/14/2016, Court orders last 5 weeks of Jail sentence is stayed, to be used as a sanction by Probation if necessary.

Defendant Jade M Bowe in court with attorney Harry R Hertel.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  court minutes filed.  Court states case and appearances.  1:53 pm - Defendant sworn in and testifies.  2:00 pm - Cross-examined by ADA L Broeren.  2:02 pm - Re-direct by Atty H Hertel.  2:03 pm - Re-cross by ADA L Broeren.  2:04 pm - ADA L Broeren gives closing argument.  2:06 pm - Atty H Hertel responds.  Requests a payment of $2,000 at this time to be made by the defendant.  Also requests $200 per month payments.  Requests balance of Jail (5 weeks) to be stayed to allow defendant to attend both work and school.  2:10 pm - Ms. B. responds in agreement to Atty H Hertel's requests.  2:11 pm - Court orders:  Last 5 weeks of Jail sentence to be stayed, to be used as a sanction by Probation if necessary.  Court orders $500 per month as restitution - 83.6% to Ms. B. and 16.4% to Mr. T.
